intro: Obione acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiny fruit bear. It is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America, characterized by its distinctive spiny fruits. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it produces showy, pink to purple flowers. The fruit, which is a capsule, is covered in sharp spines, aiding in seed dispersal by animals.
